title: Classes With 5+ Students
markdown:
# **Classes With 5+ Students**

**Difficulty:** Easy  •  **Tags:** `GROUP BY` • `HAVING`



## **Problem Description**

List all classes with 5 or more students.



## **Table Schema**

**courses**
```
+---------+------+
| Column  | Type |
+---------+------+
| student | TEXT |
| class   | TEXT |
+---------+------+
```



## **Example**

### **Input**

**courses**
```
+---------+----------+
| student | class    |
+---------+----------+
| A       | Math     |
| B       | English  |
| C       | Math     |
| D       | Biology  |
| E       | Math     |
| F       | Computer |
| G       | Math     |
| H       | Math     |
| I       | Math     |
+---------+----------+
```

### **Expected Output**

```
+-------+
| class |
+-------+
| Math  |
+-------+
```

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE courses(student TEXT, class TEXT); INSERT INTO courses VALUES ('A','Math'),('B','English'),('C','Math'),('D','Biology'),('E','Math'),('F','Computer'),('G','Math'),('H','Math'),('I','Math');
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT class FROM courses GROUP BY class HAVING COUNT(student) >= 5;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE courses(student TEXT, class TEXT);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT class FROM courses GROUP BY class HAVING COUNT(student) >= 5;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE courses(student TEXT, class TEXT); INSERT INTO courses VALUES ('A','Math'),('B','English'),('C','Math'),('D','Biology'),('E','Math'),('F','Computer'),('G','Math'),('H','Math'),('I','Math');
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT class FROM courses GROUP BY class HAVING COUNT(student) >= 5;
